title: Evan Watkins
text:
Evan William Watkins (third ¼ 1882 – 9 January 1956) was a Welsh <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a>, and professional <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> footballer who played in the 1900s, and <a href="cricket">cricket</a>er who played in the 1900s and 1910s. He played representative level rugby union (RU) for <a href="Monmouthshire%20County%20RFC">Monmouthshire</a>, and at club level for <a href="Abertillery%20RFC">Abertillery</a>, and club level rugby league (RL) for <a href="Warrington%20Wolves">Warrington</a> (<a href="List%20of%20Warrington%20Wolves%20players">Heritage № 146</a>), as a . He also played <a href="cricket">cricket</a> for <a href="Monmouthshire%20County%20Cricket%20Club">Monmouthshire</a>.
Playing career.
Evan Watkins made his début for <a href="Warrington%20Wolves">Warrington</a> on Saturday 8 February 1908, and he played his last match for Warrington on Friday 17 April 1908. He played <a href="cricket">cricket</a> for Abertillery Town Cricket Club, Blaina Cricket Club, and <a href="Monmouthshire%20County%20Cricket%20Club">Monmouthshire</a> in the <a href="Minor%20Counties%20Championship">Minor Counties Championship</a> between 1909 and 1911, making 6 appearances.
Genealogical information.
Evan Watkins' marriage to Miriam (<a href="Given%20name%23Name%20at%20birth">née</a> Davies) was registered during first ¼ 1914 in <a href="Llandovery">Llandovery</a> district.
